cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.current_location: about 125 mi (200 km) south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving north to north-northeast, expected to come ashore along the central Louisiana coast tonight and then sweep northeast across the Southeast U.S.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast near Morgan City

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning (coastal area east of Morgan City; inland warnings may follow)
weather_observation.warning_coast: East of Morgan City LA to the Okaloosa/Walton County line FL, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas and Metro New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from central Louisiana eastward to the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds up to 45 mph possible in and around the port Saturday morning
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft possible on the lower Mississippi River and Lake Maurepas near the port
weather_observation.rainfall: Widespread 4–8 in. with isolated totals to 12 in.; risk of flash flooding and river rises around the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in rainbands beginning Friday night through Saturday
